meanings.definition: Bad-tempered or difficult to deal with.
meanings.sent1: The ornery cat hissed at anyone who came near.
meanings.sent2: She can be quite ornery when she's tired.
meanings.sent3: The ornery old dog refused to share his bone.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered, looking ornery and ready to burst.
meanings.sent5: His ornery behavior made him quite unpopular among his classmates.

meanings.sent1: The ornery mule refused to move no matter what.
meanings.sent2: He gets ornery when he doesn't get his way.
meanings.sent3: The ornery toddler crossed his arms and pouted.
meanings.sent4: The rusty gate was as ornery as a grumpy old man.
meanings.sent5: Her ornery attitude made negotiations difficult.

meanings.definition: Mean or unpleasant in disposition or temper.
meanings.sent1: The ornery neighbor always yelled at kids playing near his yard.
meanings.sent2: The teacher scolded the ornery student for disrupting the class.
meanings.sent3: The ornery cashier slammed items onto the counter.
meanings.sent4: The ornery sky darkened, warning of an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: His ornery remarks left a sour taste in everyone's mouth.
